title: Christine Lampard shares adorable snap of her daughter Patricia
text:
Christine Lampard has shared an adorable snap of her thirteen-month-old daughter Patricia as she revealed the tot is learning to walk.

The TV presenter, 40, took to Instagram and posted a black and white photo of her daughter's feet.

Alongside the snap, she wrote: 'These little feet have started to walk! The adventures start now!'

Sweet: Christine Lampard, 40, has shared an adorable snap of her thirteen-month-old daughter Patricia as she revealed the tot is learning to walk

Many of the TV star's followers commented on the snap to send their well-wishes, with one writing: 'You'll be kept busy keeping up with Patricia, no need for a gym membership.'

Another wrote: 'Dont worry, the walking wont last long... running comes next - now that's the fun part.'

Christine recently revealed that she and husband Frank Lampard, 41, met at the Pride Of Britian awards ten years ago.

The Loose Women host admitted she and Frank were not meant to be at the awards the night they met.

Adorable: The TV presenter took to Instagram and posted a black and white photo of her daughter's feet and wrote: 'These little feet have started to walk! The adventures start now!'

Speaking on Lorraine, Christine said: 'It’s a strange one it is because 10 years ago that we met at them, it was one of those nights that neither of us were meant to go to.

'It was a last minute thing for him and I arrived at the awards late because of work. We were sat on tables next to each other.'

Christine added that Piers Morgan got some credit for introducing her to Frank as he 'did do an introduction', and joked: 'He was there at that moment so I can’t actually take that away from him.'

The TV personality went on to gush over Frank's skills as a father to Patricia, as she praised: 'He is very good, he has to be directed a little bit, I suppose, but he's great. He's so brilliant with her.'

She also added that their little one has 'none of my DNA in her' except her curly hair, and added: 'the rest is like daddy, everything else.'

Fate: Christine recently revealed that she and husband Frank Lampard 'weren't meant to go' to the Pride Of Britain Awards 10 years ago where their first meeting sparked romance

Meant to be: The TV presenter said of their meeting: 'It was a last minute thing for him and I arrived at the awards late because of work' (pictured at the event on Monday)

Playing cupid: Christine added that Piers Morgan got some credit for introducing her to Frank as he 'did do an introduction'

In addition to Patricia, Christine is also stepmother to Frank's daughters Luna, 14, and Isla, 12, from his former relationship with Elen Rivas.

Christine praised the two girls for helping her with the little one, as she said: 'Even simple things, I’m going to nip to the shower for two minutes and I know she’s safe because I have them. They adore her.'

Christine and Frank have been together since meeting at the 2009 Pride of Britain Awards in October, and tied the knot in a romantic ceremony at St Paul's Church, Knightsbridge, in December 2015.

Last week, Christine lifted the lid on how she first met sportsman Frank, and sweetly gushed their daughter Patricia has 'completed' them.

Happy family: The TV personality went on to gush over Frank's skills as a father to their 13-month-old daughter Patricia, as she praised: 'He's so brilliant with her'

Happy family: Christine is also stepmother to his daughters Luna, 14, and Isla, 12, from his former relationship with Elen Rivas, who she said are great with Patricia

The ITV star, who was on the judging panel of the 2019 Pride of Britain Awards, revealed why the awards ceremony is a special night for them.

She told the Mirror: 'It was a complete Sliding Doors moment, I still remember the first meeting as clear as day. Who goes to an awards ceremony and finds a husband? That was me!

'Neither of us were even meant to go and I was late after hosting The One Show. So when we are there now we do have a celebratory glass of champagne. It’s a special evening for us.'

Talking about her daughter, Christine enthused: 'We were already really happy but I suppose it does complete things. I mean, goodness me, I still look at her now, a year old, and I honestly can’t quite believe she’s mine.'
